entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/NoctilithCrownDescription
entry.value: Grants Chaos Cultists the ability to construct fortifications.

entry.name: Tau/GunDroneDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Warriors, Fire Warriors Breachers, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits, XV25 Stealth Battlesuits, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits, Cadre Fireblade, Ethereal and Commander the ability to deploy temporary basic combat drones.

entry.name: Tau/MarkerDroneDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Warriors, Fire Warriors Warriors, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits, XV25 Stealth Battlesuits, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits, Cadre Fireblade, Ethereal and Commander the ability to deploy temporary drones that mark enemies for increased damage.

entry.name: Tau/ShieldDroneDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Warriors, Fire Warriors Breachers, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits, XV25 Stealth Battlesuits, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits, Cadre Fireblade, Ethereal and Commander the ability to deploy temporary drones that shield allies.

entry.name: Tau/TidewallGunrigDescription
entry.value: Grants Builder Drones the ability to construct a heavily armed fortification that can be moved by transporting troops.

entry.name: SmokeLauncherDescription
entry.value: Grants ground vehicles the ability to launch a smoke screen that increases the ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: SmokeLauncherFlavor
entry.value: Some vehicles have small launchers mounted onto them that carry smoke canisters. These are used to temporarily obscure the vehicle behind billowing clouds of smoke, allowing it to cross open areas in greater safetyalthough it does so at the cost of being able to fire its own weapons.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AdjacencyIntegrationDescription
entry.value: Increases the building research output for each building in an adjacent tile.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AssaultWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of assault weapons.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BlessedConduitsDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cooldown of Power Surge.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BlessedConduitsFlavor
entry.value:
And when at last he came upon the vehicle, he perceived the distress of the engine therein and forthwith struck the rune and it was good. Thereupon the engine ignited and was filled with strength
Lord of the Engines, 16th Tome, Verse 2001

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BroadSpectrumDataTetherDescription
entry.value: Ability for Ironstride Ballistarii, Sydonian Dragoons, Skorpius Dunerider, Onager Dunecrawler and Skorpius Disintegrator that reduces the morale loss of adjacent Adeptus Mechanicus units.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/CognisHeavyStubberDescription
entry.value: Grants Onager Dunecrawlers a Cognis Heavy Stubber.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/CommandUplinkDescription
entry.value: Ability for Archaeopter Transvector and Archaeopter Stratoraptor that reduces the morale loss of adjacent Adeptus Mechanicus units.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/EnhancedDataTetherDescription
entry.value: Increases the morale of Skitarii Vanguards and Skitarii Rangers.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: The integration of Graian protocols into a Skitariis command circuits further enhances their already impressive survivability. The Forge World of Graia is known for its refusal to ever yield, given that their logic is simply irrefutable.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: Living by the Eye of Terror after the fall of Cadia has transformed the Adeptus Mechanicus on Agripinaa into defensive expertsparticularly, when it comes to keeping their machines running under fire.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/FidorumVossPrimeDescription
entry.value: Increases the building influence output for each building in an adjacent tile.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Ironstrider Ballistarius, Sydonian Dragoons, Fulgurite Electro-Priests, Onager Dunecrawler, Pteraxii Sterylizors and Knight Crusader the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/HeavyWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of heavy weapons.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/IconsOfTheOmnissiahDescription
entry.value: Increases the building loyalty output for each building in an adjacent tile.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/MeleeWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/OmnispexDescription
entry.value: Allows Skitarii Vanguard and Skitarii Rangers to ignore ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/OptateRestrictionsDescription
entry.value: Increases the population limit of Hab Fanes.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ReclaimatorProtocolsDescription
entry.value: Increases the growth rate of cities

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/SolarReflectorsDescription
entry.value: Increases the building energy output for each building in an adjacent tile.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/SoylensAcquisitionTeamsDescription
entry.value: Increases the building food output for each building in an adjacent tile.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ThermoExchangeEfficiencyDescription
entry.value: Increases the bonus output of Power Surge.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ThermoExchangeEfficiencyFlavor
entry.value: Paradoxically, slowing down the inputs to the Thermo-Exchanger and feeding the plasma through a second set of heat couplings and condensers can stretch the length of time it can operate beyond nominal goalsor at least reduce the amount of lives lost and repairs needed.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/TriplexNecessityDescription
entry.value: Increases the building ore output for each building in an adjacent tile.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/TwinLinkedIcarusAutocannonDescription
entry.value: Grants Knight Crusaders a Twin-Linked Icarus Autocannon.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/VoicesInTheCodeDescription
entry.value: Increases the morale loss of enemy units adjacent to Sicarian Infiltrators.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/XenariteAcceptanceDescription
entry.value: Increases the flat amount of research gained from Ruins of Vaul.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/XenariteAcceptanceFlavor
entry.value: It seems the Xenarite Tech-Priests from Stygies VIII are having their way on Gladius Prime toosetting up observation units and drones at every Outpost to understand the Xenos better. The practical applications in terms of research are immediately obvious

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/AdditionalHeavyBoltersDescription
entry.value: Grants Baneblades, Leman Russ Battle Tanks, Rogal Dorn Battle Tanks and Valkyries extra Heavy Bolters.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/AwakenTheMachineDescription
entry.value: Grants Techpriest Enginseers the ability to boost the damage of vehicles.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/BlastDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of grenade, missile and blast weapons.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/BoltDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of bolt weapons.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/BruteShieldDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage and damage reduction of Bullgryns.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/CamoNettingDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of ground vehicles.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ChaffLauncherDescription
entry.value: Grants Thunderbolts and Marauder Bombers the ability to launch chaffs that increase ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/CityTier2Description
entry.value: Increases the tile acquisition radius of cities.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/DozerBladeDescription
entry.value: Reduces the movement penalty for tanks in forests and imperial ruins.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: Most infantry in the 41st millenium are equipped with flak armour or its equivalent. If a commander wants their troops to have more than a slight chance of survival, they'll equip them with something closer to the Astra Militarum armaplas-derived carapace armour.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: Adding extra armour plates to tanks might be the height of heresy for Tech-Priests, but for the soldiers of the Astra Militarum it's the norm. Ablative plating or custom armour for dealing with particular weapons isn't unheard of.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/FragGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Bullgryns, Field Ordnance Batteries, Guardsmen, Heavy Weapons Squads, Lord Commissars, Primaris Psykers, Techpriest Enginseers and Tempestus Scions the ability to throw anti-infantry grenades.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Scout Sentinels and Bullgryns the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/HunterKillerMissileDescription
entry.value: Grants ground vehicles the ability to fire hunter-killer missiles.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ImperialSplendourDescription
entry.value: Increases the influence of Astra Militarum cities.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ImperialStrongpointDescription
entry.value: Grants Techpriest Enginseers the ability to construct fortifications with Heavy Bolters.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/KrakGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Field Ordnance Batteries, Guardsmen, Heavy Weapons Squads, Lord Commissars, Techpriest Enginseers and Tempestus Scions the ability to throw anti-armour grenades.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/LasDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of las weapons.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/MediPackDescription
entry.value: Grants Guardsmen and Tempestus Scions the ability to heal themselves during combat.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/MisfortuneDescription
entry.value: Grants Wyrdvane Psykers the ability to curse enemy units so they take increased damage.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/RecoveryGearDescription
entry.value: Increases the healing rate for ground vehicles.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/RelicPlatingDescription
entry.value: Increases the witchfire damage reduction of ground vehicles.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/TrainedSentinelPilotsDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of Scout Sentinels.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/VoidShieldGeneratorDescription
entry.value: Grants Techpriest Enginseers the ability to construct shield generators that grant ranged damage reduction to units in range.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/VoxCasterDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale loss for Guardsmen and Tempestus Scions.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ArcaneOcculumDescription
entry.value: Grants Champions of Chaos the chance to gain permanently increased accuracy when killing an enemy (Boon of Chaos).

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/BlastDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of grenade, missile and blast weapons.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/BloatedDescription
entry.value: Grants Champions of Chaos the chance to restore their hitpoints when killing an enemy.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/BoltDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of bolt weapons.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ChaosRisingDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cost of founding new cities.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ChaosRisingFlavor
entry.value: The Imperial population of Gladius know little of Chaos, but in the hell of the Xenos invasions their faith in the distant Emperor has been shaken. It is easy for your cultists and apostles to turn their minds to the Godsand to their doom.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/CrystallineBodyDescription
entry.value: Grants Champions of Chaos the chance to gain permanently increased hitpoints when killing an enemy (Boon of Chaos).

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DirgeCasterDescription
entry.value: Grants Chaos Rhinos, Defilers and Chaos Land Raiders the ability to prevent overwatch attacks.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: Most infantry in the 41st millenium are equipped with flak armour or its equivalent. If a commander wants their troops to have more than a slight chance of survival, they'll equip them with something closer to the Astra Militarum armaplas-derived carapace armour.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: Adding extra armour plates to tanks might be the height of heresy for Tech-Priests, but for the soldiers of the Astra Militarum it's the norm. Ablative plating or custom armour for dealing with particular weapons isn't unheard of.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/FragGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Chaos Lords, Chaos Space Marines, Havocs, Khorne Berzerkers, Masters of Possession and Warpsmiths the ability to throw anti-infantry grenades.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/GiftOfMutationDescription
entry.value: Grants Chaos Lord, Chaos Space Marines, Chaos Terminators, Havocs, Khorne Berzerkers, Master of Possession, Warp Talons and Warpsmith one random unlocked Boon of Chaos.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Daemon Princes, Defilers, Forgefiends, Greater Brass Scorpions, Helbrutes, Maulerfiends, Venomcrawlers and Warp Talons the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/HavocLauncherDescription
entry.value: Grants Chaos Rhinos and Chaos Land Raiders a mid-range blast weapon.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/KrakGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Chaos Lord, Chaos Space Marines, Havocs, Khorne Berzerkers, Master of Possession and Warpsmith the ability to throw anti-armour grenades.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/LasDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of las and plasma weapons.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MechanoidDescription
entry.value: Grants Champions of Chaos the chance to gain permanently increased armour when killing an enemy (Boon of Chaos).

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MeleeDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MeltaBombDescription
entry.value: Grants Chaos Lord, Chaos Space Marines, Havocs and Khorne Berzerkers the ability to deploy a melta bomb that is highly effective against heavy vehicles and fortifications.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/OurLivesForTheGodsDescription
entry.value: Increases the growth rate of Cultist Sacrifice.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/OurLivesForTheGodsFlavor
entry.value: So many now lie dead at cultists blades on Gladius that each death is meaningless, empty, shallow. But it also increases the effect of their sacrifice, as they drag this world closer to the Dark Gods fallen hell dimension, and it becomes easier for dark boons to breach the barrier with the Immaterium.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/SmokeLauncherDescription
entry.value: Grants Chaos Rhinos, Defilers and Chaos Land Raiders the ability to launch a smoke screen that increases the ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/TemporalDistortionDescription
entry.value: Grants Champions of Chaos the chance to gain permanently increased movement when killing an enemy (Boon of Chaos).

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/VeteransOfTheLongWarDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale loss, and increases the melee accuracy of infantry against units of the Space Marines faction.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/WarpflameGargoylesDescription
entry.value: Grants damage over time to Chaos Rhino, Defiler and Chaos Land Raider weapons.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/WarpflameGargoylesFlavor
entry.value: The muzzles of this vehicle's guns flicker with unnatural fire.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/WarpFrenzyDescription
entry.value: Grants Champions of Chaos the chance to gain permanently increased attacks when killing an enemy (Boon of Chaos).

entry.name: CompendiumFlavor
entry.value: Each faction expands its cities in a different way. Sometimes, it's an Ork Warboss joining his Boyz to literally lift and move his shielding walls further out, or perhaps a Necron Lord ordering his slaves to dig more of his ancient tomb from the planet's surface. However, they do it, it's necessary in order to make room for ingenious new buildings that expand their faction's capabilities.

entry.name: Drukhari/BetrayalCultureUpgradeDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty of Drukhari cities.

entry.name: Drukhari/BetrayalCultureUpgradeFlavor
entry.value: Death is a matter of course in the streets of a Drukhari city, where corpses lie slumped on every corner, waiting for the Ur-Ghuls to drag them away but the deaths of Dracons and Kabal nobles are more rare. Or they were until the Archons incubi discovered yet another plot. Now even the slightest hint of disloyalty will result in another noble body on a spike above the Archons sleeping quarters

entry.name: Drukhari/CombatDrugsUpgradeDescription
entry.value: Grants all Drukhari infantry the abiltiy to use combat drugs.

entry.name: Drukhari/CombatDrugsUpgradeFlavor
entry.value: Though combat drugs are in widespread use throughout Drukhari society, it is the Wych Cults that are happiest using them, despite their deleterious effect on their physiology and lifespan. Having a Wych cult liaison with access to their huge store of horrifying compounds is a serious boon to an Kabal making realspace raids.

entry.name: Drukhari/CorsairOutpostsUpgradeDescription
entry.value: Increases the growth by default of Drukhari cities.

entry.name: Drukhari/CorsairOutpostsUpgradeFlavor
entry.value: Rumours are spreading like the plague in Commorragh: of the wealth of Gladius Prime; of its billion suffering humans trapped beneath the Warp Storm; and of the strange wraithbone core to the planet, filled with lost Aeldari souls true or not, the Drukhari come. But who could have started those rumours..?

entry.name: Drukhari/EnergyBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the energy ouput of energy production buildings.

entry.name: Drukhari/EnhancedAethersailsDescription
entry.value: Grants Raider, Ravager and Tantalus the ability to increase their movement.

entry.name: Drukhari/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: Equipping an entire army with Ghostplate would be ruinously expensive. But for the favoured few, the Archon has splashed out. Constructed of strange resinous materials and shot through with pockets of lighter-than-air gas, Ghostplate provides considerable protection whilst weighing almost nothing.

entry.name: Drukhari/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: Whether equipped with Flickerfields or Night Shields, the vehicles of the Drukhari are hard to spot and harder to target. Integrating Ghostplate into the more prized machines is expensive, but reduces their weight and increases their speed, further reducing the likelihood that they can be hit.

entry.name: Drukhari/FieldRepairsDescription
entry.value: Grants all Drukhari vehicles the ability to restore hitpoints.

entry.name: Drukhari/GraveLotusDescription
entry.value: Combat drugs grant additional melee damage.

entry.name: Drukhari/GraveLotusFlavor
entry.value: In Devil's Orchard, noisome hanging gardens of Grave Lotus sprout from a mosaic of the dead. A vivid purple fungus, the lotus steals the fading strength of the recently dead to further its own growth. The Wych Cults steal in their turn, imbibing the lotus in liquid form to boost their own physical powers.

entry.name: Drukhari/GrislyTrophiesDescription
entry.value: Grants Venom, Raider, Ravager and Tantalus an aura that reduces the morale loss of adjacent allied Drukhari units.

entry.name: Drukhari/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Cronos, Hellions, Reavers, Scourges and Talos the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: Drukhari/HaywireGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Kabalite Warriors, Succubus and Wyches the ability to throw anti-vehicle grenades.

entry.name: Drukhari/HeavyWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of heavy weapons.

entry.name: Drukhari/HypexDescription
entry.value: Combat drugs grant move through cover.

entry.name: Drukhari/HypexFlavor
entry.value: Capturing a Psychneuein is a perilous quest, but one who does so can sell it to the Wych Cults for a high price indeed. The drug Hypex, when distilled from the insectoid creature's cerebral fluids, boosts the already-sharp reaction speed of the Drukhari to truly astonishing levels.

entry.name: Drukhari/MeleeWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.

entry.name: Drukhari/NightShieldsDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of Raiders, Ravagers, Razorwing Jetfighters, Tantalus and Voidraven Bombers.

entry.name: Drukhari/PainbringerDescription
entry.value: Combat drugs grant feel no pain damage reduction.

entry.name: Drukhari/PainbringerFlavor
entry.value: Only the exiled Duke Sliscus can claim a steady supply of Painbringer. Amongst the rarest of all augmentative elixirs, it hardens the imbiber's skin into a flexible sheath as resilient as cured leather. This process is agonising in the extreme, though its advocate consider the pain a trivial price to pay.

entry.name: Drukhari/PlasmaGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Archon, Scourges, Succubus and Wyches the ability to throw versatile grenades.

entry.name: Drukhari/RaiderFortressDescription
entry.value: Grants the ability to found new cities on claimed Webway Gates.

entry.name: Drukhari/RaidersTacticsDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of infantry Drukhari units when they disembark from transport.

entry.name: Drukhari/RaidersTacticsDamageReductionDescription
entry.value: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction of infantry Drukhari units when they disembark from transport.

entry.name: Drukhari/RaidersTacticsHealingRateDescription
entry.value: Increases the healing rate of infantry units embarked in transport.

entry.name: Drukhari/ShroudGateDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of units passing through a webway gate or a webway portal.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerCostDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cost of Soul Hunger abilities.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerCostFlavor
entry.value: As the Drukharis raid into Realspace becomes more entrenched, so the connections between this world and Commorragh become more and more numerous. Even when sealed physically, its still plausible for the Kabal to draw power from these connections and to feed stolen life back through them.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerUpgradeDescription
entry.value: Increases the influence granted by Drukhari units when they kill an enemy.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerUpgradeFlavor
entry.value: You must drug them. Kill the guards. Open the gate. Wake them carefully. Lead them out to freedom. Give them hope of escape. Start the pursuit in earnest. Fake your death. Show them an exit. Then reveal the charade. And return them to the torture chamber, grinning wickedly. Without touching them, you have imbued them with a rich, spiritual pain that will never leave. Gyrthineus Roche, Archon of The Last Blade

entry.name: Drukhari/SplintermindDescription
entry.value: Combat drugs grant morale loss reduction.

entry.name: Drukhari/SplintermindFlavor
entry.value: Splintermind is made from the ground crystal remains of a dead Eldar Farseer. Though it does not ensure prescience, this dust-like substance allows those who take it to think in several directions at once an invaluable asset, for the confusion of battle takes its toll on even the most rigorous battle plan.

entry.name: Drukhari/TormentGrenadeLaunchersDescription
entry.value: Grants Raiders, Ravagers and Tantalus Torment Grenade Launchers.

entry.name: Drukhari/WeaponRacksDescription
entry.value: Grants twin-linked to the ranged weapons of units disembarking from a Raider or a Tantalus.

entry.name: Drukhari/WebwayTravelActionDescription
entry.value: Removes the action cost from Webway Travel.

entry.name: Drukhari/WebwayTravelActionFlavor
entry.value: Though passing through a webway gate is simplicity itself, co-ordinating the movements of a large army or formation can make them vulnerable. For the Drukhari, this is solved by the creation of temporary gates around any permanent portals, allowing the entire group to move rapidly through at once.

entry.name: Eldar/AircraftBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the production output of Portal Spires.

entry.name: Eldar/AssaultWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of assault weapons.

entry.name: Eldar/AsuryaniArrivalsBonusDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cost of Asuryani Arrivals.

entry.name: Eldar/AsuryaniArrivalsBonusFlavor
entry.value:
My word is more than mere advice: it is an imprecation filtered through the consciousness of our storied dead, striving to bring one iota of order to the disordered universe. Our race understands that and listens to my word, not as that of a dictator but as an attentive student.
Farseer Kataimon of Malantai

entry.name: Eldar/AsuryaniArrivalsBonus2Description
entry.value: Reduces the cooldown of Asuryani Arrivals.

entry.name: Eldar/AsuryaniArrivalsBonus2Flavor
entry.value:
When the Warlocks and Farseers of multiple craftworlds share a visiona literal vision of the futurethen they and their craftworlds work as one. They will denude their own halls of life and spirit to fulfil their pledge to that future.
Lecture transcripts, Grigomen Delr, Rogue Trader and amateur Xenologist

entry.name: Eldar/CleansingFlameDescription
entry.value: Grants Warlocks the ability to blast adjacent foes with white-hot psychic flame.

entry.name: Eldar/ConstructionBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the production output of Bonesinger Chantries.

entry.name: Eldar/CrackShotDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy and armour penetration of Fire Dragons.

entry.name: Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrixDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Prisms, Hornets, Wave Serpents and War Walkers the ability to temporarily increase their accuracy.

entry.name: Eldar/DominateDescription
entry.value: Grants Hemlock Wraithfighters the ability to stun enemy units that are neither vehicles nor fortifications.

entry.name: Eldar/ExpertHunterDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of Shining Spears against monstrous creatures, vehicles and fortifications.

entry.name: Eldar/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: The Aeldaris thermoplas mesh armour isnt designed with a focus solely on defenseit also enables the user to move as freely as if it werent there. However, by further involuting its complex dissipation protocols, it is possible to increase its resilience with no loss of mobility.

entry.name: Eldar/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: All Aeldari vehicles and structures are literally sung into existence, by Bonesingers whose command of their vocal and psychic range is the constructive counterpart of the Howling Banshees war cry. Yet, with Gladius Primes resources and alteration in their internal harmonies, the Bonesingers can weave greater power into their creations, further increasing their resilience.

entry.name: Eldar/FoodBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the food output of Isha's Gardens.

entry.name: Eldar/GhostwalkMatrixDescription
entry.value: Allows Fire Prisms, Hornets, Wave Serpents and War Walkers to move through cover.

entry.name: Eldar/GhostwalkMatrixFlavor
entry.value: A ghostwalk matrix utilises the knowledge and wisdom contained within a spirit stone to guide the vehicle on its path.

entry.name: Eldar/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Shining Spears, Farseer Skyrunners, Avatar of Khaine, War Walkers, Wraithlords and Wraithknights the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: Eldar/HeavyWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of heavy weapons.

entry.name: Eldar/HoloFieldsDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Prisms, Hornets and Wave Serpents invulnerable damage reduction after having moved.

entry.name: Eldar/InfantryBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the production output of Asuryan's Crucibles.

entry.name: Eldar/InfluenceBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the influence output of Domes of the Seers.

entry.name: Eldar/MarksmansEyeDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of Crimson Hunters.

entry.name: Eldar/MeleeWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.

entry.name: Eldar/OreBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the ore output of Altmarls of Vaul.

entry.name: Eldar/PlasmaGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Guardians and Autarchs the ability to throw versatile grenades.

entry.name: Eldar/ResearchBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the research output of Spirit Ossuaries.

entry.name: Eldar/SpiritPreservationBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the energy gain when Aeldari units die.

entry.name: Eldar/SpiritPreservationBonusFlavor
entry.value: For time immemorial, we have mounted our spirit stones in simple casings, trusting to the skill of their owners to preserve them. Yet, the ancient webway structures we have encountered on Gladius Prime demonstrate that a complex shielding can be built into any wraithbone casing, allowing us to snatch a greater number of our dead warriors from the maw of She Who Waits.

entry.name: Eldar/SpiritStonesDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale loss of Fire Prisms, Hornets, War Walkers and Wave Serpents.

entry.name: Eldar/StarEnginesDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement of Fire Prisms, Hornets, Scorpions, War Walkers and Wave Serpents.

entry.name: Eldar/TranscendentBlissDescription
entry.value: Grants cities the ability to spend influence for a temporary increase in loyalty.

entry.name: Eldar/TranscendentBlissBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty gain from Transcendent Bliss.

entry.name: Eldar/TranscendentBlissBonusFlavor
entry.value:
To an unfettered Aeldari mind there is neither sanity nor madness, but merely a wave of perfect existence fulfilled by its own savage momentum.
Ralamine Mung, Ordo Xenos

entry.name: Eldar/VectoredEnginesDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Prisms, Hornets, War Walkers, Wave Serpents and Scorpions the ability to temporarily increase their armour against enemy ranged weapons.

entry.name: Eldar/VehicleBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the production output of Greater Ingresses.

entry.name: Eldar/WarShoutDescription
entry.value: Grants Howling Banshees the ability to demoralize adjacent enemies.

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayGateBonusDescription
entry.value: Removes the cost of activating Webway Gates.

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayGateBonusFlavor
entry.value: Only the Harlequins and the custodians of the Black Library truly know anything of the Webways transdimensional layout. But by gifting us a portion of that knowledge, pertaining only to this world, the Librarians have ensured we can re-open these ancient gates with ease.

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayGateBonus2Description
entry.value: Removes the action cost from Webway Travel.

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayGateBonus2Flavor
entry.value: Having received guidance from the Black Library on Gladius unique Webway layout, the spiritseers have planned out the shortest paths between any two gates, making the path between them as frictionless as any other step we might take.

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayRedoubtDescription
entry.value: Grants the ability to found new cities on claimed Webway Gates.

entry.name: Necrons/AircraftBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the production output of Nameless Causeways.

entry.name: Necrons/AttackCityBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of units against enemy units in cities.

entry.name: Necrons/BlastDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of blast and template weapons.

entry.name: Necrons/CityDefenseBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases damage reduction of units in cities.

entry.name: Necrons/CityDefenseBonusFlavor
entry.value: Attacks made on the Tomb City's defenders now mysteriously failenergy attacks fade, graviton weapons are deflected, and physical projectiles seem to be snatched from the sky by the tombs' Cyclopean walls.

entry.name: Necrons/ConstructionBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the production output of Slave Mastabas.

entry.name: Necrons/DimensionalCorridorDescription
entry.value: Grants infantry the ability to teleport to cities and Monoliths.

entry.name: Necrons/DimensionalCorridor2Description
entry.value: Reduces the influence cost of Dimensional Corridor.

entry.name: Necrons/DimensionalCorridor2Flavor
entry.value: Drawing upon the power of the Old One's abandoned technology has allowed the Necrons to stabilise their recall technology, greatly reducing the cost of warriors phasing out to Eternity Gates.

entry.name: Necrons/DimensionalCorridor3Description
entry.value: Removes the action and movement cost of Dimensional Corridor.

entry.name: Necrons/DimensionalCorridor3Flavor
entry.value: A cunning Cryptek's sanction has allowed the Necrons to fine-tune their recall technology, heavily increasing the acquisition accuracy when they phase out.

entry.name: Necrons/EnergyBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the energy ouput of Energy Cores.

entry.name: Necrons/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: Even after millenia of war and sleep, the Necron Crypteks have not lost their desire for innovation. Making minor adaptations to their necrodermis, they are able to increase the survivability of their troops against the weapons of today.

entry.name: Necrons/ExtraVehicleArmourDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour of vehicles and Canoptek units.

entry.name: Necrons/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: To an outside eye, these Necron vehicles are identical to their predecessors. To a Cryptek or perhaps even a learned Aeldari, they can see that the material of the vehicle has increased its resilience, somehow without affecting its density or weight.

entry.name: Necrons/GaussDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of gauss weapons.

entry.name: Necrons/GaussPylonDescription
entry.value: Grants cities the ability to raise powerful gauss fortifications from the ground.

entry.name: Necrons/GloomPrismDescription
entry.value: Increases the witchfire damage reduction of Canoptek Spyders and adjacent allied units.

entry.name: Necrons/GrowthBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the growth rate of Necron cities.

entry.name: Necrons/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Destroyer Lords, Tomb Blades, Canoptek Spyders, Transcendent C'tan, Triarch Praetorians and Triarch Stalkers the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: Necrons/HousingBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the population limit of Shelters.

entry.name: Necrons/InfantryBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the production output of Summoning Cores.

entry.name: Necrons/InfluenceBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the influence output of Stelae.

entry.name: Necrons/LivingMetal2Description
entry.value: Increases the healing of Living Metal.

entry.name: Necrons/LivingMetal2Flavor
entry.value: In some abstruse sense, the Necron's machines now remember their former glory and endlessly strive to regain it, flowing their living metal rapidly back to cover any damage.

entry.name: Necrons/LoyaltyBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty output of Baroque Shrines.

entry.name: Necrons/MeleeDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.

entry.name: Necrons/NebuloscopeDescription
entry.value: Allows Tomb Blades to ignore ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: Necrons/NecrodermisRepair2Description
entry.value: Increases the hitpoint restoration from Necrodermis Repair.

entry.name: Necrons/NecrodermisRepair2Flavor
entry.value: The Crypteks have improved the nanomechanical structure of the Necrons' living metal bodies once again, allowing them to recover from almost any damage.

entry.name: Necrons/NecrodermisRepair3Description
entry.value: Removes the cooldown of Necrodermis Repair.

entry.name: Necrons/NecrodermisRepair3Flavor
entry.value: The living metal that constitutes the Necron bodies and vehicles now constantly writhes, rebuilding itself from moment to moment.

entry.name: Necrons/OreBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the ore output of Al-Khemic Quarries.

entry.name: Necrons/QuantumShieldingDescription
entry.value: Grants Annihilation Barges, Ghost Arks, Doomsday Arks and Triarch Stalkers invulnerable damage reduction that goes on cooldown at the start of the next turn if damage is taken.

entry.name: Necrons/RapidRiseBonusDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cost of Rapid Rise.

entry.name: Necrons/RapidRiseBonusFlavor
entry.value: The Lord strengthens his patron-client protocols, so that his orders are carried out with more speed and less thoughtif less free will.

entry.name: Necrons/ReanimationProtocols2Description
entry.value: Increases the healing of Reanimation Protocols.

entry.name: Necrons/ReanimationProtocols2Flavor
entry.value: With these Cryptek-derived repair and revival systems, Necrons are even more likely to shrug off apparently-fatal damage.

entry.name: Necrons/ResearchBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the research output of Forbidden Archives.

entry.name: Necrons/ScarabHiveDescription
entry.value: Grants Canoptek Spyders the ability to construct Canoptek Scarabs.

entry.name: Necrons/SeismicAssaultDescription
entry.value: Grants Transcendent C'tan and Tesseract Vaults the ability to perform a devastating strikedown.

entry.name: Necrons/ShieldVaneDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour of Tomb Blades.

entry.name: Necrons/TeslaDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of tesla weapons.

entry.name: Necrons/TheBoundCoalescentDescription
entry.value: Grants Transcendent C'tan the ability to merge with Obelisks to create Tesseract Vaults.

entry.name: Necrons/VehiclesBuildingBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the production output of Hypostyle Temples.

entry.name: Orks/AmmoRuntDescription
entry.value: Grants Big Meks, Flash Gitz and Mek Gunz the ability to increase their ranged accuracy.

entry.name: Orks/BigbommDescription
entry.value: Grants Deffkoptas the ability to drop anti-infantry bombs.

entry.name: Orks/BlastDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of grenade, missile and blast weapons.

entry.name: Orks/BosspoleDescription
entry.value: Further reduces the morale loss of Mob Rule for Big Meks, Boyz, Meganobz, Tankbustas, Warbikers and Warbosses.

entry.name: Orks/BosspoleFlavor
entry.value: Ork Nobz often sport a trophy pole that shows they are not to be messed with. A Nob with a Bosspole often finds it comes in handy when cracking heads to restore some order in the heat of battle.

entry.name: Orks/CityEnergyDescription
entry.value: Increases the energy output of Ork cities.

entry.name: Orks/CityInfluenceDescription
entry.value: Increases the influence output of Ork cities.

entry.name: Orks/CityLoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty output of Ork cities.

entry.name: Orks/CityPopulationLimitDescription
entry.value: Increases the population limit of Ork cities.

entry.name: Orks/CityResearchDescription
entry.value: Increases the research output of Ork cities.

entry.name: Orks/CreatePermanentOrkoidFungusOnDeathDescription
entry.value: Causes units to create permanent orkoid fungus when they die.

entry.name: Orks/EavyArmourDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour of Boyz and Warbosses.

entry.name: Orks/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: To any other race, Ork armour seems ridiculous: great lumps of thick metal plates, attached by cables, nails and nonsensical apparatuses, painted gold by lumpen Meks and grotz. But with a little bit of Ork belief, it works like a charm.

entry.name: Orks/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: When a Mek is faced with a Warboss angry that his buggies and battlewagons keep getting blown up, he'll rapidly order his grots to dig out some scrap and nail extra armour anywhere it fits. He knows the Speed Freeks will soon enough peel it off, after all.

entry.name: Orks/FlybossDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged accuracy of Dakkajets against flyers, jetbikes and skimmers.

entry.name: Orks/GrabbinKlawDescription
entry.value: Grants Battlewagons the ability to immobilize enemy ground vehicles.

entry.name: Orks/GrotRiggersDescription
entry.value: Grants Warbuggies, Killa Kans, Battlewagons, Deff Dreads, Gorkanauts and Kill Burstas passive hitpoint regeneration.

entry.name: Orks/HealingRateDescription
entry.value: Increases the healing rate of units.

entry.name: Orks/HealingRateFlavor
entry.value: Through the co-operation of a team of Bad Doks and Runtherdz, your Warlord has prescribed a new, 'more Orky' diet, to make the boyz bigger and stronger, quicker. Whether the cold Oil Squigs for breakfast and Faceeater Squigs for dinner actually has any physical effect is immaterialthe boyz believe it, and that makes it work.

entry.name: Orks/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Deff Dreads, Deffkoptas, Gargantuan Squiggoths, Gorkanauts, Killa Kans and Warbikers the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: Orks/MeleeDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.

entry.name: Orks/MightMakesRight2Description
entry.value: Increases the influence gain of units dealing damage.

entry.name: Orks/MightMakesRight2Flavor
entry.value: When a Waaagh! is powerful enough, it has something like a multiplying effect, with every blow struck further enhancing the leaking psychic field, in a sort of ultra-violent Orky feedback loop.

entry.name: Orks/OrkoidFungusBonusHealingRateDescription
entry.value: Increases the healing from orkoid fungus.

entry.name: Orks/OrkoidFungusFoodDescription
entry.value: Increases the food output of tiles with orkoid fungus.

entry.name: Orks/RedPaintJobDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of Warbuggies, Megatrakk Scrapjets, Battlewagons, Dakkajets and Burna-Bommers.

entry.name: Orks/Scavenger2Description
entry.value: Increases the amount of salvaged ore when killing enemy units.

entry.name: Orks/Scavenger2Flavor
entry.value: A well organised Runtherd will have trained his Grots to gather and sort scrap for the Orks, as well as avoiding the more dangerous shell casings and munitions.

entry.name: Orks/SkorchaMissileDescription
entry.value: Grants Burna-Bommers anti-infantry missiles that ignore cover.

entry.name: Orks/StikkbombDescription
entry.value: Grants infantry the ability to throw anti-infantry grenades.

entry.name: Orks/TankbustaBombDescription
entry.value: Grants Tankbustas the ability to throw anti-armour bombs.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/AdditionalHeavyBolterDescription
entry.value: Grants Immolators, Exorcists and Castigators one additional Heavy Bolter.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/AdditionalSacredRiteDescription
entry.value: Two Sacred Rites can be simultaneously active.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/AdditionalSacredRiteFlavor
entry.value:
Once, our ritual chorals were singularsolos or harmonies sung in sacred voice. Today, we weave our hymns together, to amplify their dual themes, so that we may praise the God-Emperor in as many ways as possible.
Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/AircraftsMissilesDescription
entry.value: Grants Skystrike Missiles to Lightning Fighters and Hellstrike Missiles to Avenger Strike Fighters.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/AircraftsMissilesFlavor
entry.value: These missiles allow the aircrafts to effectively engage a variety of targets; Hellstrike missiles for missions targeting armoured vehicles, Skystrike missiles for enemy air forces.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/AssaultWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of assault weapons.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/AvengeTheMartyrsDescription
entry.value: Increases the morale loss reduction from Avenging Zeal.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ChaffLauncherDescription
entry.value: Grants Lightning Fighters and Avenger Strike Fighters the ability to launch chaffs that increase ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/CityGrowthDescription
entry.value: Increases the growth rate of cities.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/CityTier2Description
entry.value: Increases the tile acquisition radius of the main city.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/CityTier3Description
entry.value: Increases the tile acquisition radius of the main city.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DozerBladeDescription
entry.value: Reduces the movement penalty for Immolators, Exorcists and Castigators in forests and imperial ruins.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ExpertFightersDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of Lightning Fighters and Avenger Strike Fighters.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: Constructed from thick ceramite plates, the power armour worn by the Adepta Sororitas is based upon the same archaic systems as that worn by the brethren of the Adeptus Astartes. It provides the same degree of armoured protection, yet must forego the more advanced support systems and strength enhancing abilities, for the Battle Sisters do not possess a Space Marines ability to interface directly with their own armour.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: The vehicles of the Adepta Sororitas are demonstrations of faith, so it is crucial to maintain and protect the exposed artefacts they bear. So preserved, these vehicles will more easily cover the advance of the order Militants of the Adepta Sororitas.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/FragGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Battle Sisters, Canonesses, Celestian Sacresants, Dialogus, Dominions, Hospitallers, Imagifiers, Paragon Warsuits, Retributors, Saint Celestine, Sisters Repentia, Zephyrims the ability to throw anti-infantry grenades.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Cerastus Knight-Lancer, Mortifiers, Paragon Warsuits, Saint Celestine and Zephyrim the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HeavyWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of heavy weapons.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/KrakGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Battle Sisters, Canonesses, Dialogus, Dominions, Hospitallers, Imagifiers, Retributors, Sisters Repentia and Zephyrims the ability to throw anti-armour grenades.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LaudHailerDescription
entry.value: Grants Castigators, Exorcists and Immolators an aura allowing adjacent shaken units to perform Acts of Faith.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MedicusMinistorumDescription
entry.value: Grants feel no pain damage reduction to allied infantry units adjacent to a Hospitaller unit.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MeleeWeaponBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MeltaBombDescription
entry.value: Grants Battle Sisters, Canonesses, Dialogus, Dominions, Retributors, Sisters Repentia and Zephyrims the ability to deploy a melta bomb that is highly effective against heavy vehicles and fortifications.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MinistorumIndoctrinationDescription
entry.value: Grants Martyr Spirit to Lightning Fighters, Avengers Strike Fighters and Cerastus Knight-Lancers.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MinistorumIndoctrinationFlavor
entry.value:
Through long exposure to our rituals and prayers, our allies of fortunethe Imperial Navy and the handful of Imperial Knight-Lancers who had survivedbegan to take part in our rites and internalize our beliefs too. Faith, it appears, is contagious.
Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RitualizedCeremoniesDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cost of Sacred Rites.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RitualizedCeremoniesFlavor
entry.value:
At first, we prayed on the move, in moments of peace in ruins or caves. In time, as the conflict stabilized into endless, grinding war, our rituals and prayers stabilized too, to form a regime and routine.
Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SanctifiedWorldDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty bonus granted by Convent of Faith.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SanctifiedWorldFlavor
entry.value: Most Orders spread the illumination of the God-Emperor to worlds far beyond their primary sanctuaries, establishing far-flung missions and subsidiary chapels to extend the influence of their Order and the Ecclesiarchy.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/UniversalCatechismDescription
entry.value: Grants Shield of Faith to Lightning Fighters, Avengers Strike Fighters and Cerastus Knight-Lancers.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/UniversalCatechismFlavor
entry.value: Imperial troops requisitioned for the Wars of Faith often end up praying side-by-side with the sisters of the Adepta Sororitas before each battle, finding guidance in their convictions.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/VowOfTheMilitantOrderDescription
entry.value: Units keep their Shield of Faith if they are broken.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/BlastDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of grenade, missile and blast weapons.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/BolsterDefencesDescription
entry.value: Grants Thunderfire Cannons the ability to increase the ranged damage reduction of the target tile.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/CeramitePlatingDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour of Stormraven and Stormtalon Gunships.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/ChapterUnityDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty output of the Great Hall.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/CityTier2Description
entry.value: Increases the tile acquisition radius of the city.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/ClusterMinesDescription
entry.value: Grants Scout Bikers the ability to place cluster mines.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/CombatShieldDescription
entry.value: Increases damage reduction of Assault Space Marines.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/DozerBladeDescription
entry.value: Reduces the movement penalty for Hunters, Predators, Razorbacks and Whirlwinds in forests and imperial ruins.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: Whilst purity seals may well keep an Adeptus Astartes in the field for longer, faith doesn't stop all bolts. By upgrading to later versions of their Power Armour, Space Marine infantry improve their survivability substantially.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: When the proper unguents have been spread and blessings made, a Techmarine may well make some minor changes to his charges, in line with Codex Astartes of course, to improve survivability.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/FortressOfRedemptionDamageReductionDescription
entry.value: Grants Fortresses of Redemption an invulnerable damage reduction.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/FortressOfRedemptionMissileSiloDescription
entry.value: Grants Fortresses of Redemption a krakstorm missile silo.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/FragGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Apothecaries, Assault Space Marines, Captains, Devastator Space Marines, Librarians, Scouts, Scout Bikers, Tactical Space Marines and Thunderfire Cannons the ability to throw anti-infantry grenades.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Assault Space Marines, Dreadnoughts and Scout Bikers the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/HurricaneBolterDescription
entry.value: Grants Stormraven Gunships a hurricane bolter.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/HurricaneBolterFlavor
entry.value: First used by the Black Templars Chapter, hurricane bolters combine the punishing firepower of multiple twin-linked boltguns to produce a truly withering storm of shells.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/KrakGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Apothecaries, Assault Space Marines, Captains, Devastator Space Marines, Librarians, Scouts, Scout Bikers, Tactical Space Marines and Thunderfire Cannons the ability to throw anti-armour grenades.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/LandSpeederMultiMeltaDescription
entry.value: Grants Land Speeders and Land Raiders a multi-melta weapon.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/LastStandDescription
entry.value: Increases the morale of all Space Marine units.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/LocatorBeaconDescription
entry.value: Causes orbital deployment to not consume action points when deploying adjacent to Scout Bikers or Stormraven Gunships.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/MeleeDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/MeltaBombDescription
entry.value: Grants Tactical Space Marines, Assault Space Marines, Devastator Space Marines, Scouts and Scout Bikers the ability to deploy a melta bomb that is highly effective against heavy vehicles and fortifications.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/OmniscopeDescription
entry.value: Grants Devastator Centurions the ability to bypass ranged damaged reduction.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/OrbitalDeploymentDescription
entry.value: Grants units the ability to deploy via drop pod anywhere on the battlefield.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/PredatorLascannonDescription
entry.value: Grants Fortresses of Redemption, Predators and Aquila Macro-Cannons extra Heavy Bolters.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/SiegeShieldDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour of Vindicators and reduces the movement penalty in forests and imperial ruins.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/SignumDescription
entry.value: Grants Devastator Space Marines the ability to negate the penalty for heavy, ordnance and salvo weapons.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/TeleportHomerDescription
entry.value: Causes orbital deployment to not consume action points when deploying Chaplain, Assault Terminators and Terminators adjacent to Tactical Space Marines or Scouts.

entry.name: Tau/AdvancedTargetingSystemDescription
entry.value: Battlesuit support system and vehicle upgrade that increases the ranged accuracy.

entry.name: Tau/AutomatedRepairSystemDescription
entry.value: Grants vehicles hitpoint restoration each turn.

entry.name: Tau/BlacksunFilterDescription
entry.value: Increases the sight of vehicles, Ethereal, Commander, Pathfinders and Battlesuits.

entry.name: Tau/BlastDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of flame and missile weapons.

entry.name: Tau/BoltDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of burst and rail weapons.

entry.name: Tau/BondingKnifeRitualDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Warriors, Fire Warriors Breachers, Pathfinders, XV25 Stealth Battlesuits, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits, XV88 Broadside Battlesuits, XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuits and XV104 Riptide Battlesuits the ability to restore their morale.

entry.name: Tau/CounterfireDefenceSystemDescription
entry.value: Battlesuit support system that increases the accuracy of overwatch attacks.

entry.name: Tau/DroneControllerDescription
entry.value: Battlesuit support system that increases the accuracy of adjacent drones.

entry.name: Tau/EMPGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Warriors, Fire Warriors Breachers and Pathfinders the ability to throw anti-vehicle grenades.

entry.name: Tau/ExtraInfantryArmourDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour of infantry and monstrous creatures.

entry.name: Tau/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: Further studying the chitinous carapace of our Thraxian comrades has revealed substantial structural improvements we can make to the composition of our Cadre and Battle Suit armour.

entry.name: Tau/ExtraVehicleArmourFlavor
entry.value: Unlike the stagnant Techpriests of Mars, the Earth Caste are endlessly innovating and creating. Fiotak is the material that is the current peak of their creativity, a hard, ultra-dense, nano-crystalline metal alloy used sparingly on their finest creations.

entry.name: Tau/FlechetteDischargerDescription
entry.value: Grants vehicles the ability to damage melee attackers.

entry.name: Tau/ForTheGreaterGoodBonusDescription
entry.value: Reduces the influence cost of For The Greater Good.

entry.name: Tau/ForTheGreaterGoodBonusFlavor
entry.value: When our Water Caste diplomats are in the field, they sometimes find it useful to take along our fungoid Charpactin allies, whose strobing ultraviolet communications have a sedative, almost hypnotic, effect on nearly all races.

entry.name: Tau/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants XV95 Ghostkeel Battlesuits, XV104 Riptide Battlesuits, XV107 R'Varna Battlesuits and KV128 Stormsurges the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: Tau/LasDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of fusion, ion, plasma and pulse weapons.

entry.name: Tau/PhotonGrenadeDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Warriors, Fire Warriors Breachers, Pathfinders and Cadre Fireblades the ability to throw blinding grenades.

entry.name: Tau/PointDefenceTargetingRelayDescription
entry.value: Grants vehicles increased overwatch damage against enemy units adjacent to other friendly units.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseEnergyDescription
entry.value: Grants the ability to purchase energy with influence.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseFoodDescription
entry.value: Grants the ability to purchase food with influence.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseOreDescription
entry.value: Grants the ability to purchase ore with influence.

entry.name: Tau/PurchasePopulationDescription
entry.value: Grants the ability to purchase population with influence.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseResearchDescription
entry.value: Grants the ability to purchase research with influence.

entry.name: Tau/RipykaVaDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cooldown of the Commander's metastrategies.

entry.name: Tau/SeekerMissileDescription
entry.value: Grants vehicles and XV88 Broadside Battlesuits a missile weapon.

entry.name: Tau/SensorSpinesFlavor
entry.value: Sensor spines are used to feed data to an advanced ground-following flight control system, plotting safe courses through treacherous terrain that avoid traps and mines that might lie hidden from sight.

entry.name: Tau/ShieldGeneratorDescription
entry.value: Battlesuit support system that grants invulnerable damage reduction.

entry.name: Tau/StimulantInjectorDescription
entry.value: Battlesuit support system that increases feel no pain damage reduction.

entry.name: Tau/SubversionBonusDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty penalty of Subvert City.

entry.name: Tau/SubversionBonusFlavor
entry.value: Whilst conducting oppositional research, the Tau found the phrase think like your foe in a human military textbook. The Water Caste have taken it to heart and thoroughly investigate the unfulfilled needs and desires of a given settlementwhether shivering Necron slaves or squig-hungry Ork boysbefore fomenting rebellion.

entry.name: Tau/TacticalSupportTurretDescription
entry.value: Grants Fire Warriors an additional weapon when stationary.

entry.name: Tau/VectoredRetroThrustersDescription
entry.value: Battlesuit support system that increases movement and allows the unit to ignore enemy zone of control.

entry.name: Tau/VelocityTrackerDescription
entry.value: Battlesuit support system that increases the ranged accuracy against flyers.

entry.name: Tyranids/AcidBloodDescription
entry.value: Grants Tyranid monstrous creatures and Tyranid Primes the trait to damage all melee attackers.

entry.name: Tyranids/AdrenalGlandsDescription
entry.value: Grants units increased movement and increased melee damage.

entry.name: Tyranids/AdrenalGlandsFlavor
entry.value: Adrenal glands saturate their host's bodies with chemicals that boost the creature's metabolism to a hyperactive state of frenzy.

entry.name: Tyranids/BiomorphDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of biomorphs.

entry.name: Tyranids/BioPlasmaDescription
entry.value: Grants Carnifexes an additional ranged weapon.

entry.name: Tyranids/BoneMaceDescription
entry.value: Grants Carnifexes an additional melee weapon.

entry.name: Tyranids/CityCostDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cost of founding new cities.

entry.name: Tyranids/CityCostFlavor
entry.value: The role of the Malanthrope in founding new Tyranid hives has been little studied by Imperial Genetors, as in most circumstances they're dead or fleeing when the hive is founded. However, it's believed that they transport the city seed to new locations when a forward brood location is required. Unusual Malanthropes have sometimes been observed, with specialised physical structures that enable them to perform this task more efficiently.

entry.name: Tyranids/CityDamageDescription
entry.value: Enemy units in Tyranid cities take damage each turn.

entry.name: Tyranids/CityGrowthDescription
entry.value: Increases the growth rate of Tyranid cities.

entry.name: Tyranids/CityLoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Decreases the loyalty penalty from the amount of Tyranid cities.

entry.name: Tyranids/CityPopulationLimitDescription
entry.value: Increases the population limit of Tyranid cities.

entry.name: Tyranids/CityProductionDescription
entry.value: Increases the production output of Tyranid cities.

entry.name: Tyranids/CityTier2Description
entry.value: Increases the tile acquisition radius of the city.

entry.name: Tyranids/ConsumeTile2Description
entry.value: Decreases the influence cost of consuming tiles.

entry.name: Tyranids/ConsumeTile2Flavor
entry.value: Whilst a Malanthrope or Ripper's razor-edged jaws have no problem eating their way through flesh, bone or even plasteel, they are slowed by the necessity of consuming the huge quantities of soil and rock the Hive Mind demands at scale and speed. It is presumed that specialised organisms are deployed to consume thesethough, again, none have survived to report them.

entry.name: Tyranids/DesiccatorLarvaeDescription
entry.value: Grants Hive Tyrants, Tervigons and Tyrannofexes a template weapon.

entry.name: Tyranids/ExtraInfantryArmourFlavor
entry.value: The Hive Mind is a frugal mentality. Why sacrifice resources armouring troops that will be reclaimed anyway? Only when the gamble makes sense, does it invest in extra-thick chitin and bone for its fauna.

entry.name: Tyranids/ExtraMonstrousCreatureArmourDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour of monstrous creatures.

entry.name: Tyranids/ExtraMonstrousCreatureArmourFlavor
entry.value: Through a combination of hardened carapaces, disruptive fields and deadened nerve endings, the Hive Mind can alter the resilience of its larger creatures easily.

entry.name: Tyranids/FleshHooksDescription
entry.value: Grants Tyranid Warriors, Tyranid Primes and Lictors an additional ranged weapon.

entry.name: Tyranids/HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Grants Exocrines, Gargoyles, Haruspexes, Hive Crones, Hive Tyrants, Maleceptors, Scythed Hierodules, Tervigons, Trygons, Tyrannocytes and Tyrannofexes the ability to perform more devastating attacks.

entry.name: Tyranids/InfantryUpkeepDescription
entry.value: Reduces the biomass upkeep of infantry.

entry.name: Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride2Description
entry.value: Reduces the influence cost of overriding instinctive behaviour.

entry.name: Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride2Flavor
entry.value: Maintaining control of its troops is a major concern of the hive mind and one it seeks to overcome by various adaptations, such as its synapse creatures. A simpler one is to reduce the natural savagery of its units when they run feral, so they require less psychic effort to bring back under control.

entry.name: Tyranids/LongRangedDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of long-ranged weapons.

entry.name: Tyranids/MeleeDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.

entry.name: Tyranids/ParoxysmDescription
entry.value: Grants Zoanthropes the ability to curse enemy units so they have decreased accuracy.

entry.name: Tyranids/PreyAdaptation2Description
entry.value: Increases the research gained when enemies die in the area of a Malanthrope.

entry.name: Tyranids/PreyAdaptation2Flavor
entry.value: An unusual adaptation of the Malanthropic form, gustarflagelli are filament thin tendrils that surround a malanthrope like a fleshy, wriggling cloud. It's presumed that they enable the Malanthrope to gather and retain more genetic data from recently-deceased enemies.

entry.name: Tyranids/ProductionBuildingUpkeepDescription
entry.value: Reduces the influence upkeep of production buildings.

entry.name: Tyranids/Reclamation2Description
entry.value: Reduces the influence cost of reclamation.

entry.name: Tyranids/RegenerationDescription
entry.value: Grants Tyranid monstrous creatures and Tyranid Primes hitpoint restoration each turn.

entry.name: Tyranids/ResourceBuildingUpkeepDescription
entry.value: Reduces the influence upkeep of resource buildings.

entry.name: Tyranids/ShortRangedDamageDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of short-ranged weapons.

entry.name: Tyranids/StingerSalvoDescription
entry.value: Grants Hive Crones an additional ranged weapon.

entry.name: Tyranids/ThresherScytheDescription
entry.value: Grants Exocrines and Haruspexes an additional melee weapon.

entry.name: Tyranids/ToxinSacsDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of melee weapons against infantry and monstrous creatures.

entry.name: Tyranids/ToxinspikeDescription
entry.value: Grants Trygons an additional melee weapon.

entry.name: Tyranids/VehiclesUpkeepDescription
entry.value: Reduces the biomass upkeep of monstrous creatures.
